Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Macaroni and Cast Iron Mac  Cheese
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily Cast Iron Biscuits

2JpiL54FrTtYDtPIZL721g.text: The food was good and service was good here. Only downfalls were the smaller portion sizes and the outdated decor. They advertise as modern but they're a little more old school inside. Would eat here again if we come back to Charlotte!

i_WxTvxZFfjgkWPkxHY2eQ.text: Came here for my 22nd Birthday and had the chicken Sammy it was amazing. The service was friendly and had good recommendations. The atmosphere was really warm and inviting the place was quite. Not too busy for a Saturday night so I hope that they can stay open this place was amazing!

LdG3RIUlk6MWPkW4wZNPNA.text: Finally a place for a solid brunch!   My husband and I walked over here for brunch on Sunday. The space is small and isn't the greatest of atmospheres, but we were happy to be seated immediately.   We began with the chef's choice deviled eggs, which are always something new but always delicious. We also ordered the sticky biscuits, which are a great appetizer. Bite size biscuits with ham drizzled in goat cheese icing.   We both ordered cocktails as well, and they were affordable and very delicious! I ordered the $12 Morning Sunshine - St. Germain, Grand Marnier, blood orange soda, and sparkling rose. My husband ended up getting 2, $10 Wake up Right because they were so delicious! Iced coffee, Evan Williams bourbon, Damn Fine Chocolate, almond milk, orange, and cinnamon. We we're seriously very pleased with the drinks.   For entrees we ordered the Chicken in a Biscuit and the Southwestern salad. The chicken was just divine. Perfectly cooked and had so much flavor. We replaced the cheese fondue with the popular pimento cheese gravy. It was a great call. Seriously so great for $10! The Southwestern salad was fresh and delicious. Great lettuce.   We haven't been happy with the brunch scene in Charlotte, but the Asbury proved us wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Morning Sunshine
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Champagne toast for brunch
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken in a biscuit

4wQD7FloAumDJ2JHstTCVg.text: Had Sunday brunch here with friends. Space is fine. The place was dead from noon (when we arrived) until about 1:30 when it got pretty busy. Service was good. This is a restaurant hotel.   We ordered the deviled eggs and sticky biscuits to start. Both were ok but the sticky biscuits portion was tiny (these are bite sized biscuits, but you do get about 8 of them in the order).   I order the omelet on special. For $10 it was a 2 egg omelet, served with no side, and it was served with a different cheese than the waitress said it was. Unfortunately I hate cheddar and that's what it was served with, though the waitress had specifically told me it was another cheese prior to me ordering. The omelet was not for me and was tiny. My husband ate it. I ordered a biscuit and it was hard as a rock.   My husband had the meat and potatoes entree and it was REALLY small. He ate again immediately after we left the restaurant (even though he had my entree and his).  We have friends who love this place, but I likely won't be back.

zaUSBekTuOuSQ1wLQrfMzA.text: While my finger was leaning towards the 5 stars, I would definitely want the full experience before I made that call. As our experience went though, we had a very nice time, with nice service (especially given the circumstances) and delicious food.  I arrived with a group of girlfriends on the night of the Justin Timberlake concert in Charlotte. We used Yelp to find nearby restaurants to our hotel. I don't think we had realized how nice this place was when we arrived; we were looking for a quick bite to eat of quality, non-fast food. As soon as we walked up, we realized that this location was going to be nicer than our expectations but we were starving and ready to relax after a road trip from Raleigh.  The hostess, who I believe was also the manager, was very friendly as she informed us the restaurant (the seating area itself looked very small) was full given the events in town. But she immediately offered that we could sit at the bar area. She led us to some nice, plush lounge chairs and told us the bartender would help us though he was a bit swamped as well. After taking our drink orders, she left and we perused the menu. Everything sounded delicious but the logistics of eating an actual meal in our lounge chairs seemed awkward. So we decided to do a tapas assortment of the various items from the appetizer menu.   The manager ended up coming back to take out order which we appreciated given how swamped the bartender was. She was very friendly the whole time and also quick to refill our drinks. About 10 minutes after our order was placed, our multiple items came out. They all looked incredible but also tasted delicious. We were very happy with our decision and it seemed to help with both the quick turnaround time to leave before the concert as well as how to eat a meal with our seating situation.   We had a really nice experience at the Asbury and I would definitely come back for a more formal dining experience in the restaurant itself.

AlQ5BcqAIMZW5bGRuhHQqg.text: My wife and I came on a Monday to basically an empty restaurant. The server was attentive and informative. We started with the rabbit pasta and one other dish I can't remember. Both were delicious and great dishes for two people to share. My wife had the catfish and I had the lamb neck. Both were amazing and perfectly cooked. Our dessert, the beeswax cake with ice cream was delightful. We both left happy with full stomachs, but not too full. The only qualm we had is that apparently the head bartender doesn't work on Mondays so our drinks were slightly inconsistent in presentation but on the plus side maybe slightly stronger than usual....which we didn't mind!  Great place for a date night or quick bite in the bar area.

pDC_VRoiUGeETpDtJemqGQ.text: What a wonderful, cozy gem in the middle of uptown! The atmosphere, food, and service were all outstanding during our Friday date night! I couldn't believe more people weren't there.  For starters, we ordered the skillet biscuits and the deviled eggs. The biscuits came with a mouth-watering, delicious bacon jam. I also don't normally like deviled eggs (Goose ordered them), but these were amazing! Apparently the deviled egg menu rotates, but the mustardy filling in these was much better than the mayonnaise overload at your family reunion potluck.  For main course, Goose ordered the fried chicken sammy and was really impressed. I got one of their seasonal salads, and it was the perfect size and flavor for the season!   We stayed for dessert, and ordered their bread pudding. I would also not normally ordered this dish (what can I say, I really love my man), but it was so good! It was infused with cream cheese and golden raisins, which added the perfect holiday spin on this similarly dicey potluck staple.  Our server was very attentive, and everything came out quickly. Would definitely come back!!

q7VM2PLBF22yC39_TaTNsQ.text: Compliments to the chef. Delicious dishes, excellent preparation and presentation. Great service, prompt and friendly. Quiet on a Sunday night, perfect date spot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rabbit

_k10w5WIRQ3cfToY7abVLA.text: We came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and I'm so glad we made this choice! We started with the sticky buns which were to die for. I will absolutely come back and eat multiple orders of these. I had the beef cheeks for dinner which were tender and served over creamy mashed potatoes. The husband got the fried chicken sandwich which sounds simple but it was so perfectly fried with homemade pickles and a great bun. For dessert they gave us our choice and we went for the vanilla panna cotta with pumpkin seeds, granola, and apple and it was the perfect finish to the meal with just enough sweetness that didn't overdo it. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States

WncnIndTdbRhLW0NM-Gh-w.text: Stopped in for Sunday brunch.  Food was average, got biscuits and gravy with eggs and potatoes.  Service was poor.  I was offered another cup of coffee but the waitress never came back to fill it.  She walked over to table next to me asked if they were doing ok, they asked for their check and before I could get her attention she went back behind the doors to kitchen.  I waited for her or someone else to come out.  By that time I was finished with my meal, coffee and water glasses completely empty with no refills even after it was offered to me.  Kept waiting to get my check finally after several minutes I got up and went to the hostess counter.  Another waitress walked out said "I'll be with you in just a moment" she then came back and asked if she could help me, I said I just need to pay my bill. She looked at me confused & said "you were at the bar?" I said "no I was right there" pointing to my table 10 feet away (they place is small so all the tables are close) I got my bill gave her $20 bill for $16 & change she looked at me confused I said "I need change" she brought me my change & I left.   If you like to be ignored and looked at with blank stares for basic dining service needs this is the place for you.

T_3iFk03bErASoCXHBdFMw.text: It was fine. I hate when I'm not excited to review a place I've been to.  That's the only thing that keeps popping up in my head when thinking about my experience at The Asbury. I remember the entire experience, the food, the service, and it all comes back to, "Yeah, it was fine."  My experience was on Valentine's Day and there was a prix fixe menu for everyone that night. The options weren't too overwhelming, but there were a couple things I expected to really enjoy.   They started us off with an oyster amuse bouche. It was lightly fried but still super oyster-y. It wasn't my favorite consistency but my girlfriend really enjoyed it. I went with the pan-seared scallops as my first, and it was actually quite delicious. Scallops were cooked well and had roasted parsnip puree and chicharrones which made it a little more fun.  For the second course, I had the duck and was disappointed. The fat hadn't been rendered down enough and the skin wasn't crispy. The flavor was there but just an off-putting consistency with the fat. Very meh.  The third course was pretty solid - a red grouper with mushrooms, turnip, and harissa. The fish was nice and meaty was was able to stand up to the harissa so it was enjoyable.   Desserts were pretty decent and we both split each of ours. One was a suncrisp apple cake and one was a chocolate and peanut butter inspired. Both were pretty good and a nice way to end the meal.  Overall, the plates were a bit rushed out, as was the wine. I understand Valentine's Day is a busy night for restaurants, but I don't want any of my wine pairings brought out before I finish the previous dish. Just seems sort of sloppy.  I wanted more from The Asbury after hearing some good things and it being a big night.  It fell a little short of expectations and unless someone REALLY wants to go here for a special occasion, I doubt I'll be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate ganache - peanut butter textures, chocolate sorbet
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Suncrisp Apple cake - cream cheese buttercream, pickled apples
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oyster amuse bouche

u5n21dYGpyUbc-Gfl4oJAQ.text: This place is pretty small so get a reservation before going. Don't bring your loud ratchet friends, this isn't the place for them.  Maw Maw's Cast Iron Biscuits: This is a must. The bacon jam is the reason to come here. It's not life changing to where you will only eat bacon jam the rest of your life, but something worth trying. Biscuits are perfectly soft and with a hit of salt.   Southern Benedict: This is the reason I gave it 3 stars. Cut into the poached egg, and what run's out? Nothing, because the yolk was completely cooked. Really disappointed in that. Smothered in pimento cheese.  Biscuits + Gravy: Honestly, it's pretty basic and not what you should get when trying a place for the first time. But it was good, and I enjoyed it. The potatoes were great as well.  I probably won't come again, but I do recommend coming for those cast iron biscuits.

WSO8OW_hami0TAOWbpeXLg.text: The Asbury was an overall wonderful experience. The service was exceptional and the menu can be perfectly described as both southern and modern. Our server was extremely knowledgeable of the menu and made it quite difficult to decide on an entree, as everything sounded so delicious. With the chef focusing on regional ingredients and farm to table freshness, this menu truly gave a taste of North Carolina. It would be highly recommended that both residents and visitors of Charlotte take the time to enjoy all that this new restaurant has to offer. I would recommend coming sooner than later and ask about anything special regarding the wine list. Make a reservation, the restaurant does appear to have limited seating.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States

SE888fNNlWEITiSOaqBPxg.text: In town for business and stopped here for sunday brunch. The pork belly sandwich was amazing! I want another one now. The staff was extremely friendly and responsive. Highly recommend!

OhwhaY0Mk2TeFIKCFaowkA.text: First of all, I love that this restaurant is connected to one of our favorite hotels - The Dunhill. My fiance and I went here for dinner and were very impressed. We started with their famous biscuits with the bacon jam as an appetizer. This is a must when you come here - delicious! The Pork Cheeks and Chicken & Dumplings entrees were exceptional! For dessert, we had the key lime pie and that was great as well. Service was excellent. I had a sparkling moscato which was just how I wanted - not too sweet and not too dry. Definitely check this restaurant out!

T1fL6aZ1MkCjfXP9e0ZOHw.text: Delicious breakfast. The chicken on the biscuits was the most flavorful and tender I have ever had. The sticky rolls were the best!

ztngfS_xul-q9mtgBYneDQ.text: Enjoyed a casual business breakfast today at Asbury.   I was hoping it would live up to the quality of Harvest Moon which used to be here.   It did!  Ordered the Farmers Biscuit with sausage gravy,  bacon, eggs  topped with arugula, and a side of grits.  Everything tasted great so why not 5 stars?  Just a few little things:  I ordered poached eggs and received fried,  too little sausage gravy which the biscuit quickly sopped up, and I had gone online to research the menu only to discover they had switched their menu from Winter to Spring and not updated their website.   I had my heart set on the root vegetable omelet . . . but it was gone. Service,  however,  was impeccable.  I'll be back!

FPkHoYXT0mif6k3Mzj9gRA.text: Went for Sunday brunch as it was outstanding. We ordered skillet biscuits with bacon jam, Crab cake benedict and amazing omelets. The benedict was the best I have ever had. The crabcake was awesome and the eggs were topped with a basil hollandaise sauce. The grits were fresh and very rich and flavorful. Service was outstanding as well.

QzUExpNZyWsSSaF2RNuuHA.text: If you want your validated parking to be easy, go elsewhere. Had to park my car twice to go back in and eventually was told I had to deal with the parking garage. Food was excellent but sour taste in my mouth with customer service from the hotel.

xuCFIIfBNFz2EgkX1pO1Jg.text: The wife and I went to check out the brunch at The Asbury with another couple this past Sunday. It has replaced Harvest Moon Grill in the Dunhill Hotel, which I had only tried once and left very disappointed. I don't think both restaurants are affiliated in any way, and I can safely say that The Asbury hit the spot for brunch. It's in a relatively small space in the Dunhill with an entrance on Tryon.   The menu itself is also not overly abundant but there is a good variety. The biscuits, deviled eggs, and southern French onion soup were enjoyed by all as the whole table split these snacks. I don't even like biscuits and these were very good in a bad for you kind of way. I ordered the "carrot" hummus which was different but definitely worth a try especially with the crispy crackers that accompanied it.  For entrees, the dishes were cream cheese stuffed french toast, pork belly Benedict and the wife and I each took the smoked trout hash. We didn't really share these dishes, but we all wound up with empty plates so that means something. For dessert, the table split the chess pie, which is apparently a old school southern dessert that I had never had before. It came out with 3 pieces of pie stacked up on each other with the actual chess pie being in the middle surrounded by pieces of chocolate pie on either side. In a word, it was delicious! We will definitely be returning here soon and trying out the lunch and dinner menus.

4hmoIHqz8q1gJjDZl_TuRQ.text: Everything was amazing! From our server, Donnie, to the sticky biscuits (crazy ridiculous), to the specials for dinner and the best Mac and cheese of my life!  I will be back as frequently as possible!  If you haven't been, you need to go. Great service, atmosphere, and food. They got everything right!

eVDxu0hz6yRhJnZuvv6N0g.text: This place was good but overpriced. The coffee was good. The toast wasn't really wheat toast. The fruit wasn't all that special. It was just purely mediocre at best and to pay nearly 20$ for it was a bit of a punch to the gut.

pKzcPLLgsVXgXxs-luS75Q.text: Had the opportunity to have dinner here Sunday before a Broadway show - spectacular experience all around. Service was on-point and very timely since they were aware of our showtime. Food was amazing! We had items from the fall menu and everything from the appetizers (deviled eggs, chicken liver risotto), to the entrees (trout, veggie platter) were thoughtful, fresh and well executed. The harissa beets were revolutionary and I could eat an entire plate by myself! We loved the entire experience and wished we had more time to do a full chef's tasting. We will be back!

muU1YO20L66CaAqhx8e9TQ.text: Have enjoyed dinner at The Asbury as few times.  The food is great and the menu creative.

Nzd462BVexd5XjUkKIs5cA.text: Place is just ok, nothing great. Service was good and food was average. It served the purpose for what we were looking for.

06zNze3a1G_ZhJ9O9cFp4g.text: Wow!! Loved this place. Old historic hotel in uptown. We went for brunch and this place looked high end and pricey. It is, but so worth it. I have been dying for pork belly and this place offered it to me in the form of breakfast!!! So, I had a Mamosa and the boyfriend had a bloody Mary both good but both not included in our brunch. Our waiter was slow and took a little long coming back to us. I then ordered the Pork belly, egg, and cheese Sammy. Omg, the pork was porky, and salty and fatty and so good!!! MY egg was cooked exactly as I asked and I'm just realizing now that I didn't get the Dragon cheddar on it that I was supposed to, but nonetheless it was delicious. I ate it open face and the roll was really good, almost brioche-ish and it sucked up all the porky juices. It came with grits which were delicious but not over-the-top great and they were actually very heavily textured. Kind of looked like there was shredded corn in there if you know what I mean.  My boyfriend got the crisp waffle and grilled peach. He said it was the best thing he ever tasted. The waffle was big and light and fluffy slightly sweet and so delicious. The Nutellla on the top was just incredible and the only complaint he had was that he would've preferred canned peaches (believe it or not) because they are sweeter and softer. I'll be going back again for dinner to have a romantic night on the town in this historic hotel that looks very quaint and cozy and a throwback to the 20s.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle and peach with Nutella
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly and egg and cheese Sammy

jRTyIGrLH8bnw8efiMObXA.text: We had the bacon wrapped duck & venison raviolli small plates.  we both found the duck excellent, I found the venison and ravioli too dry but my fiance enjoyed it.  the sauces were very good also.  For large plates we had the grilled trout & the pork cheeks which were both outstanding.  The service was great as our waiter was extremely knowledgeable of each menu item.  We highly recommend!

8KTc8V6ug-nm5byu96NmxQ.text: Breakfast for the gods! I absolutely love this place and Ms.Robin !! She makes me always wanna come back! I had an amazing hoagie bread with eggs bacon cheese and home fries.. (yes made up my own meal) but its some of the best food ive ever had  No complaints here. Im a breakfast girl and they have mastered that for me.. I havent had dinner since it was harvest moon but if much hasnt changed I had some amazing lamb once upon a time from chef cassie that literally made me feel like my life changed for a day.. Also shouts out Pete at the bar.. I always visit him after dinner!

hsyJqXNPs7N56xmNvVznOw.text: Great for Sunday brunch. Good hot omelettes and coffee. Good service too. Enjoyed a table outside today!

1Y5UMLFpc8_ApPRlPb7jFw.text: We missed Harvest moon but wanted to try this new place. I ordered the Fried hot chicken Sammy. Oh My God!!! It was just amazing. It was so full of flavor that I relished each and every bite. There was no conversation during this lunch since everyone was lost in their food. AMAZING!!

vaUOBqIrf0xY1Msrq3QOQw.text: We love dining here especially during lunch. Their lettuce cups are our favorite! We would highly recommend anything with the cast iron chicken. Maw maw's cast iron biscuits are a great way to start the meal and you'll have some leftover for breakfast. This is a great spot for working lunches or meeting with clients.

_GE595fEdTuade1VGr1IMQ.text: My finace's and my experience at The Asbury was lack luster and mediocre at best. For the price and location, we expected much better food, tastes and drinks.  We are not picky eaters at all, we absolutely love food anywhere and all the time. I ordered the New Fashioned cocktail and it tasted like watered-down whiskey. The pumpkin bisque tasted like water, lacking seasonings and salt. The biggest disappointment was the lamb heart and carrots. Our server failed to explain that this dish was cold, shaved lamb with raw carrots. I suggest you do not order it.   As for the entree, we ordered pork cheeks. These were tender and supposed to come with a "sweet potato casserole" - which proved to be sliced cooked sweet potatoes with a meringue. However, you foodies, the meringue was not luscious and delicious as imagined, it is only a crumbled up meringue cookie.  All in all we will not be returning - don't waste your time or money.

50xfWIgNEXI29FMnkrL9tQ.text: Had a great brunch here a while back. Had some excellent chicken and waffles with biscuits for some serious carb loading. Would definitely come again.

n7osejXnQwycKs8QofL2QA.text: Found this place while, visiting Charlotte. Small and quaint but clean and airy.  Loved the light tastiness of the food and different ingredient mixed in the plates.   Good: -MawMaw Biscuits were soft and flaky (serves 4 biscuits, ask for bacon jam) -Deviled Eggs  -"The Burger" is a safe and solid choice -"Fried Hot Burger" tasted better to me, it was delicious  Bad: -Go after the lunch rush -They were out of bacon jam, but the raspberry was ok

5qO4WinEyGonIfY6c6br1w.text: Man, I'd like to give these people a higher rating, but I can't.  Service was good, food was definitely fresh, but...  they charged me $12 for a salad that didn't even fill half of the bowl it was in.  The carrots on it were undercooked, and in inexplicably large chunks.  Minus 1 star.  They are very expensive for the area, and my pork cheek main dish was ok, but I was left with the impression they are trying too hard to be fancy rather than focusing on the taste.  So, minus another star.  Even though I will be in and out of the area for months, probably won't be back.

n7HP3a69G9wo3qv0gQV7lg.text: The spoonful of liver and onion risotto had no flavor except rice. If you dont like liver and onions, this is the dish for you. The cheeseburger featured two crunchy brown discs that must have been cheese left on the griddle till it burned. I think the dishes were prepared as intended. We ordered these because they had less food terminology that had to be looked up in the descriptions. If this is new southern locally sourced cuisine, you can have it. The menu made it seem like the chef just threw together as many disparate ingredients as possible and called it dishes. We had room service at the Dunhill Hotel, so I can't comment on the restaurant itself.

PVVkrYsVUfQxkLgkdbyt_g.text: Very cool twist on traditional dishes. Was in town for business quickly and this place had a ton of great reviews, that they certainly lives up to. I recommend stopping in here for lunch and grabbing just about anything on the menu!

X-WvsMzLFvgZUpvKo7nX6A.text: In two words, disappointing service.  Memorial Day weekend should have been a very good opportunity to showcase this "modern southern" bistro in a very nice hotel.  Indifferent attentiveness and an inferred reluctance to give top-notch service detected from the two visits to The Asbury.   The food was very good.  Chickpea hummus, biscuits, grits, and crabcake Benedict ..  all good.  Perhaps it was a training or staffing issue.  Nice artwork on display, too.

Yq4CmFxZBNht29ivLwZSsg.text: I came to Charlotte just for three days and I was looking for a brunch place before leaving the city . Totally loved the ambiance and the food . I ordered the deviled eggs , I don't know how they do the filling of the eggs but the texture and flavor was so good . The sticky biscuits are a must try , sweet biscuits with a goat cheese sauce and bits of bacon , if you like the sweet and salty combination then you'll love the biscuits. My boyfriend had the omelette of the day which came with Sloppy Joes .  Overall  very cute little place overall

BR2rutG9fFTbnytNOyXE5A.text: Went here because we went to see Once at the Belk Theatre. This used to be my beloved Harvest Moon Grille, so I wanted to see if they do it justice, and overall, they did with a few miscues. So I really give this place 3.5 stars, rounding up to 4 (I feel generous today).   Got the deviled egg appetizer. They added a FRIED pickle to the top....that was unexpectedly YUMMY! Then I got the sirloin over a mushroom risotto. Well, the beef was kind of "sinewy" and tough to chew in a few cases. About 5 or 6 oz of beef.....which was a little less that I was expecting for SIRLOIN....NOT the most expensive cut of meat. So the beef was average at best. But the risotto was very good. My friend got the roasted chicken leg, which she loved.....I thought it was good.  Didn't have time for dessert, but they all looked fabulous! I got a glass of wine and she got a Martini. Service was excellent and the atmosphere romantic and cozy.  Overall a pretty good place. Had they given me a BETTER quality piece of beef this would be a solid 4 star place. Right now it' s a solid 3.5 stars.

Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sirloin over truffled saffron risotto.
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled Eggs with a FRIED pickle on top....Nice!

xs_7M5ft84bTO5Cj94JP1A.text: The fella and I stopped in for Sunday breakfast around 8:45, and we were the third group in there. We'd been excited to try the place that replaced Harvest Moon, and I was pleasantly surprised by the transformation! The interior looks very different with a long, ivory, leather booth along one wall, and dark, wooden tables throughout. The walls are dark blue on the top, and the art is very sleek and modern without being too fancy.  The menu was potentially even more impressive than Harvest Moon's, and I had a hard time deciding what to get! I decided on the House-Made Ricotta & Granola ($8) with a side order of toast. The baked apples were a delicious touch, and how has no one ever thought to add a dollop of ricotta to granola before?? Even the preserves that came with the thick, yet light, toast were to die for. The fella opted for the Pimento Cheese Omelet with grits ($9). He was dumb enough to give up a bite and let me try it, and the flavor was smoky with a nice tang from the cheese. The grits were sooo thick, and he loved it!  The only reason I didn't award a fifth star was service. When we first got there, it was perfect.  Around 9:00 a.m., they were so busy that there may not have been an open table in the place. I needed more coffee and more preserves, but our waitress never came back, and the others look super overwhelmed. Hopefully the staff will get the hang of things soon, and I'm looking forward to trying it again!

U2CDtxK7Mu8d3zYim5BK1w.text: Food and service was good, but selections left a bit to be desired.  The raved on Mac and Cheese balls where not all that.  Take this with a grain of salt though, since I did visit on weekday "brunch".

gqxKsz-Bg8ORylqSZlPUAw.text: Loved The Asbury.....adored!!! I was really looking forward to going, I love the farm to table idea anyway and with a Southern twist...woo hoo! Had a glass of nice dry French rose wine to start and knew I had to get Maw Maw's biscuit with bacon jam, now I don't exactly know how they make bacon jam, but I know it's amazing!!!! Bacony, smoky, richness to put on that wonderful biscuit, which is huge BTW, share the love! Also knew I had to get the deviled eggs. I am so glad to start seeing them on menu's again, yeah they are retro but so good. These were fabulous as well, sorry I can't help but throw around all these positive adjectives. I thought the mustard seeds really went so well with the eggs and fried pickle. The portions are very generous in size, the service was really great, loved the decor...and the food...aaaah. I want to try their brunch when I'm in town another time. Bravo to The Asbury!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs...MUST get these too!
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maw Maw&#39;s bacon jam &amp; huge delish biscuits...you MUST get this!
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. A lovely dry French rose

30eCeGkADB8y3aYBisYeVQ.text: Had pre-show dinner at The Asbury and was generally pleased. We started with drinks, I highly recommend the Espresso Martini. Followed that with the Sampler starter: BBQ Caramel Popcorn, Deviled Eggs, Butter Bean Hummus, and Icebox pickles: delicious and a beautiful presentation. I then had the Roasted Beet Salad. It was good, just not great. I would prefer a creamier goat cheese on that salad as the whipped Chevre was almost a dessert consistency. Then I had what was probably the best beef ribs I've ever eaten. Delicious! I highly recommend them.  Would I dine at The Asbury again? Ehhh.,,not sure because of the sheer number if delicious restaurants in Charlotte. But, I'm glad we had the experience.

pB3potKp7RaneYOOeG6nkQ.text: Love Coming here for brunch although I cry every time there out of the Mac and cheese bites. All the appetizers are delicious ! The bacon jam is one of a kind. Can't forget my favorite player though ..... The benedicts!

5JGljFYmiRdtYDnWk_3xyQ.text: We stopped into The Asbury for brunch after running the Charlotte Half Marathon this past weekend. They have an excellent brunch menu - highly recommend. The grits were spot on. The biscuits were the True star of the show -- made fresh in house and served with your choice of honey butter, raspberry jam, or bacon jam. The service was great as well and our waiter was extremely attentive.

CWM_errEovFZrmaLFaujhA.text: Tried a number of small plates, all were pretty good (although not hot). Service had a few hiccups - no one came to our table for over 15 minutes after being seated and there was an error with the food order - but the staff took a few items off the bill to compensate. Also, the volume is high for a fancier spot. Wine list was well-curated. I'd give it another try next time in town.

2VtddyzPuMCDFqPPgrXA-g.text: Southern comfort breakfast. Much needed after along week at work. Delicious flavours and great presentation topped with gracious service. What more can one ask for on a Sunday morning. I had a hard time picking from the various options but am glad I went with the recommendation. Sticky biscuits - small enough for a solo meal and crab benedict. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sticky biscuits. Oh deliciousness!!
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict with grits

nwgHMrt2OXWdsKS1KxVJsg.text: Really nice setting, however the service was extremely poor for our table. The waiter took about 30 minutes to bring the coffee. The food was decent (except the sweet potato donuts which were extremely hard). We got the fresh salad & the fried chicken biscuit. We sat there a little over 2 hours watching numerous people come and go while we were still waiting for our check. The manager was kind enough to give us gift cards for our next visit which most likely won't happen. As someone who worked in the service industry, I have pretty normal expectations and would not recommend this place to my friends or family.

OPLXc7wSC3Q3CRFECW3POQ.text: quick, attentive service paired with an atmosphere that allows you to sit back, relax and catch up without feeling rushed. The mimosa's were excellent, as was the griddled sourdough toast.

3-WIeewSYqGEYhgr01uCAQ.text: Went for a brunch and was stunned by the famous biscuit with bacon jam! Great combination of savory flavor and sweetness. Also ordered the crisp waffle - the waffle was ok and the cinnamon apple on the top was a bit too sweet for me. But I really liked the peanut butter cream - rich and smooth but not too sweet. Def coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crisp waffle
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. The famous biscuit with bacon jam! Yummm

T0DT_yXW3VOP51Y0EZ4nrQ.text: This place is like foodie heaven. They tell you the source of everything (mostly local) before you order it and give you a piece-by-piece breakdown of everything when they bring you the plate. The service is impeccable. The quality and ease of our waiter's wine and food suggestions indicate the staff here really take passion in the dining experience Asbury provides and are all very familiar with the menu.   Per our waiter's recommendation, we started with the Duck Confit, which came out as tender little rolls around pickled apple relish that were great. My wife had the Scallops, which were cooked perfectly amid golden rice and pickled beets. But one of the most amazing dishes I've had to date are the Pork Cheeks. The meat was bursting with flavor and one of the most tender, fall-off-the-bone cuts I've had; really impressive.   If we are ever in Charlotte again I would love to come back for a Chef's tasting, brunch or another delicious dinner.

3PSp-200swmsjFEO_Mhz2w.text: EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT service from the front door to the wait staff. My guest had the Fried Springer Mountain Chicken Sammy (spicy chicken sandwich) with fries. It. Is. HOT, as in spicy. The fries are perfectly crisp. My guest found it to be too hot and I was thrilled to take care of it because I ordered the deviled eggs which I found to be too salty. The deviled eggs were not the ones listed on the menu or in recent pics which was disappointing. Overall, I recommend this restaurant and was overwhelmed with the fantastic service. They didn't charge for the Sammy even though I greatly enjoyed it.

ZIKqK4RS_ke9J54vBysQMQ.text: I literally can't express my empty bank accounted frustration of walking in here and seeing all these reviews for 6$ biscuits with bacon jam. BACON. FREAKING. JAM. Ugh please payday come quick because I need to try it.   But as for things I could actually pay for, the chicken Sammy is easily one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had. Super moist chicken meat and doesn't feel to fatty while eating it.  It's super simple and equally as delicious.  Our waitress was a nice young woman who filled our water glasses practically after each sip. I loved it.   I also remembered this place after being at taste of Charlotte this past summer. I was desperate for a bathroom and they were the only place I could find that were gracious enough to allow me a tinkle.  Asbury is both delicious and kind, folks!

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy chicken sammy

_fgvh9A_kRSGM4VlvWHOGw.text: A single day in Charlotte on business is not enough. I live in Los Angeles but grew up in Virginia and went to school in the Shenandoahs, and, as much as I love where I came from, I think we can do better in the way of food. The Asbury is already doing just that.  I was invited to the Asbury for a business lunch and actually ate there again mere hours later because I had to try their dinner menu. The disappointing thing about the Asbury is not the Asbury. It's that no one seems to be ordering their best dishes. I visited at the end of June, and I had the most superlative tongue dish of my life, ox tongue with raclette: intensely beefy fatty beef with intensely melty cheesy cheese. I've had tongue a thousand times. (Realistically, a hundred times.) And this was pleasant upon pleasant, a southern "bitch, please" to the trend of smothering vinegars and citruses on beautiful meats and their rightful fats. (Bless their hearts.) My server said no one ever ordered it.  SIGH. I think the Asbury is west-coast-worthy but more than that it's east-coast-worthy if only the east coast would accept it as its own and eat the whole menu. Hint hint.

3pPnvJqrO1n2rBD4RyN4Gw.text: Grabbed dinner here before heading to a concert. OMG amazing service, food and drinks. The restaurant was empty on CIAA wknd so I was nervous that me and my party of 5 was screwed.   Our waitress was so nice and patient with or group. The chef sent out devil eggs - which were good. We ordered the Peary dreamy martinis - Woot woot the bartender deserves an Oscar.   The bbq Carmel popcorn is a party for your mouth. They even let us have the bar menu - the burger and chips heaven.   We will be back - such a tasty spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum burger.

Zcesdd4kFsppTUoDMvsSwg.text: Ate here this evening with a party of 12 people. Most of us are staying at The Dunhill, so it seemed convenient. I was pleasantly surprised at the level of culinary excellence with our meals.  We shared several appetizers as a table, including the cheese plate and deviled eggs. I had the mushroom salad, and oysters as well. For dinner I had the braised lamb, which was phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Braised lamb.

36luKaFglxTsKIf8MasrhA.text: The Asbury is a nice brunch spot that is part of the Dunhill hotel. I came here with a few girlfriends on a Saturday morning and we were seated fairly quickly. We ordered two pitchers of mimosa which were pretty good and maw maws cast iron biscuits and deviled eggs to start. I ordered the chicken and waffles as my entree and wasn't impressed. The chicken was nicely seasoned but not crispy and the waffles were soggy. The syrup they give you is more like honey, and I don't enjoy honey on my waffles. Additionally the plate is topped off with sauteed greens (collard greens I think?) that were strangely sweet. My friend ordered the Mac and cheese which was tasty so I ate some of that instead. For the price the Asbury charges, I expected better quality food. On the bright side, our server was really friendly and attentive. If I'm in the area again, maybe I'll give the Asbury another try and order something different.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles ($14)
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs ($6)
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maw maw&#39;s cast iron biscuits ($8)

-FElYbb9Pa8srw1npLnq2A.text: I love their dinner but this review is for Sunday brunch. First off they don't take reservations for brunch but we were immediately seated. The noise level was quite loud and everytime I've dined here I've been uncomfortably warm which it very unusual for me.  I love the decor and large window to the street. Our server was very attentive and the food came out fairly quick.   I wasn't as impressed with the food compared to their dinner menu. Everything sounded great but unfortunately it was just ok for me when I tasted it. I kept thinking about things to add to the dish that would make it better. I got the crab cake Benedict. I didn't even taste the crab cake and I prefer a more zesty hollandaise. The flavors didn't really pair well with the heavy biscuit underneath. I also tried my husband's chicken sandwich. It was pretty good but again I kept thinking it lacked a punch. Perhaps a spicy aioli. The French press was really good and we got the sticky biscuits as and app. Unfortunately they were too doughy for my tatse. You cant go wrong with the maw maw biscuits. I think from now on I'll stick to dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States

PhA0hwM5O_y9j_EVs5_BIw.text: YUM. This brunch was heavenly. The bartender was very friendly and they have amazing carafes of mimosas. The food itself was cooked perfectlyyy, loved the breakfast potatoes and grits. Can't wait to go back.

7Fv1gCoFyvPDchSU9L8mqQ.text: The atmosphere. The drinks. The service. The food. ALL were excellent!  We went for brunch and were SO, so pleased! I had the Grains salad and several of my friends had Chicken in a Biscuit (they out-ordered me!). We had mimosas and a Tito's and lavender drink that was to die for. We will absolutely be back!!

ln80FbFTBtsNZ9cV3MiXJQ.text: I am going into this review letting you know I am already biased. It's high-class dining, which means--as a vegetarian--there are never many options. So I can not fairly rate them on all their food. But for vegetarians out there: this review is for you.   It's a fine dining facility in the floor of a hotel. So the atmosphere is relaxed (even though it tries to be fancy). You can never be fully "fancy" when you have people walking around in the lobby in front wearing jammies and fluffy slippers. It does a good job playing the part of fancy though.   The drink menu is great, good quality drinks. Well made, and local wines. The wine sampler is a great touch.   The menu is very unique, and like any upscale dining facility, expensive. But you get what you pay for. Very unique, quality ingredients, made from local ingredients.   With all the positive, why onlu give it 3 stars? Well, like I said, this is based on the quality of the food as a vegetarian. I had their deviled eggs, which were only ok. Nothing unique, but this was the only vegetarian app on the menu at the time. They did not have anything veg on the main menu, but they were willing to work with me to make some unique. Which was nice of them, for sure. However; when I got my dish it was basic and bland. Just roasted vegetables with no flavor. $26 for a plate of vegetables is a little much.   Everyone else seemed to enjoy their dishes well enough. There was nothing people were "over the moon" about, but no one had a bad experience either. Overall it was decent, but not a great place for a variety of people/preferences. Their menu is too niche that doesn't feed to a large number of people.

7mVFmD5WIgbNFjEPmA6K9g.text: Went for brunch and thoroughly enjoyed. Their menu is not extensive, but they are very good at what they have. Chicken and waffles are my personal favourite. It is located at the Dunhill hotel which is British themed and a great place for a Saturday morning get together.

-Zf6dMZ5k3iXEMqBWeJ9mA.text: The service is slow but I think that's the trend in the south.  So you'll spend at least an hour eating the different portions. The food however is really good.  The grits were amazing and the deviled eggs were spectacular. The chicken and waffle was great and moist and the gravy on the chicken and biscuit was interestingly delicious. I would come here again just for the grits.

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Panzanella
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States

GUCnb-raqUyEj2Q1M4abww.text: In Charlotte to dodge the hurricane. Found The Asbury on Yelp. Previous reviews helped. We all thought the restaurant was very good. Southern food on a bit of the upscale side. I had fried chicken, wife the fish special and kid Mac & Cheese. Leave room for desert!

tlS1ZQ-f54RRFmNt4uGk8w.text: I was not impressed by Asbury and since I left my review on TripAdvisor I have horrible stomach cramps, which can only be attributed to this restaurant.   The first time I went to this restaurant for dinner, about 3 weeks back, the service was terrible and the noise level was absurd so we left after 10 minutes, before we even got our drinks. They then called and offered me a gift card to come back and I accepted. Today I used said gift card and was once again disappointed. Upon arriving we waited for at least 10 minutes before someone came to our table after I made eye contact with at least 2 of the waitresses who were just standing around talking by the kitchen. We then got our biscuits and the bacon jam was terrible. I have had bacon jam multiple times and I don't know if it was meant to be sour but it tasted like it had almost gone bad. Our food was mediocre. Nothing I would go back for, I had a burger and my date the fried chicken sandwich. Since we did not have time to finish our meal we had to get to go boxes. My date asked for a container for his soup, which was piping hot and they gave him a round plastic container that had CLEARLY been used previously...watermarks and all. I am disappointed and even if they offered me another gift card I would ask them to please keep it.

aZfEtVMMy6LyDsu6JbTKwQ.text: Wonderful! The service here was amazing and my warm kale salad with trout was delicious.

NfVYJMPhIAmxwJHA1xhHJQ.text: The Asbury was on a list of must do restaurants in downtown Charlotte. I have to agree the food was great. The cheese plate was paired with unique accompaniments. The pork belly was melt in your mouth. The Old Fashioned was great with a southern smokey twist.

o64Ahzp-wWXro734BDvN8w.text: The waiter was super knowledgable but needs to learn to respond to diners question instead of giving a sermon on the menu. Contain his enthusiasm....  I had the devil eggs to start, great flavor and the fried pickle on top was the best I have had in a southern restaurant! My main course was a locally sourced Lamb Chop, it was cooked a perfect medium rare, it had a sumptuous amount of fat surrounding the meat, great flavor in the actual fat! I am thankful for our friend bringing us here before Lewis Black. We will return.

i_hN08Ldx_0fFvrDuMctHw.text: The Asbury is one of my favorite restaurants here in Charlotte. Quaint, inventive menu, high-quality ingredients, and intimate.  Farm-to-Table concept with an added element of that theme being as most of the meat that they serve comes straight from the Chef de Cuisine's Family Farm. Dinner is Great and brunch is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Springer Mountain Chicken n Waffles
Photo of The Asbury - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Style Benedict- Benton&#39;s Ham, Poached Egg, and Pimiento Cheese Gravy served on an open faced biscuit.

WC9-yunwZPJBhVWvAQyRbw.text: A coworker and I stopped in for a snack and a drink while we brainstormed.  The server was great and the snacks (deviled eggs, skillet cornbready thing) were tasty.  My only issue was that there were a ton of small flies flying around outside that were getting annoying.  But hey, it's summer, it's Charlotte, these things happen.  Overall - 4 stars.  Solid.

usTDiNp46G9SQSk0mhzemg.text: I think they tried... they really tried, but failed to execute. The flavors were bland and nothing distinctive. Dishes lacked dimension and balance. The food came out lukewarm. The staff did come over to inquire about how they could improve and I hope the chef takes my comments into consideration. There's potential there, but it seems like these dishes are experimental and not worthy of a final presentation.
